result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J. Steinmetz Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.
  • Knowingly Possess Methamphetamine Waste [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.67(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael J. Steinmetz Jr.

defendant.name: Steinmetz, Michael J., Jr.
defendant.address: 28 N. Brown Street, Apt. 315, Rhinelander, WI 54501

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 2:48 p.m. Attorney Andrew J. Jarmuz in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek offer of proof as to restitution - Oneida County Department of Health request for cleaning and testing costs of premises to ensure that premises is habitable for future residents - total restitution requested - $300.34. Jarmuz statement - opposed to restitution to Oneida County Department of Health - not a direct victim in this case - Court statement - Court does not find that Oneida County Department of Health is a victim of crime as it does not have a relationship to crime on record - Court finds no authority to grant request for restitution to Oneida County Department of Health and denies request for restitution.  Restitution to owner/manager of building is proper - Restitution granted to property manager in amount of $150 and imposes statuory surcharge. Jarmuz moves to waive any surcharges - denied.  Court states restitution to be paid as a condition of probation. Adj. 3:01 p.m.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
11:47 a.m. Defendant Michael J. Steinmetz in court, in custody, with attorney Andrew J. Jarmuz. Michael William Schiek, D.A., appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also calling 14CM421/outstanding costs. Plea questionnaire filed. State speaks to agreement/resolution. Parties free to argue sentence. State moves to dismiss repeater allegations in Cts. 1 & 2. State moves to dismiss and read-in Cts. 3-6. State does not request presentence. Court grants State's motion to dismiss but read-in Cts. 3-6; grants motion to strike repeater in Cts. 1 & 2. Defendant pleads guilty to Cts. 1 & 2. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea; waiver free & voluntary. Court finds factual basis for plea exists and finds defendant guilty of both counts. Schiek statement to sentencing/speaks to health hazards and clean up; requesting restitution. Jarmuz/Steinmetz statement. Court sentence; eligible for CIP & Substance Abuse Program. Court requests State to provide case law and additional information with regards to clean up costs; takes restitution under advisement. Court orders costs remitted in 14CM421.

Court sentence - Ct. 1
WSP 6 1/2 yrs. (18 mos. initial confinement & 5 yrs. extended supervision)
105 days' credit
CC/CV/Supervision Fees
Restitution - to be determined/under advisement
DNA surcharge
WEDS given
Ineligible Voting Notice given
Appeal Rights

Ct. 2 - concurent to Ct. 1
WSP 4 1/2 yrs. (18 mos. initial confinement & 3 yrs. extended supervision)
105 days' credit
CC/CV/Supervision Fees
Restitution - to be determined/under advisement
WEDS given
Ineligible Voting Notice given
Appeal Rights
while defendant is an inmate in Oneida County jail, he may have contact with co-defendant Jamie Rickert, no contact with Crystal S. Schirmacher remains

10:36 am - Defendant Michael J. Steinmetz in court with attorney Andrew J. Jarmuz.  Defendant Michael J. Steinmetz in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Schiek addresses motion concerning another case - in camera Chapter 51 records.  Court questions defendant as to the in camera inspection by the Court.  Defendant agrees to allow the court to proceed with the inspection.  Jarmuz statement to bond modification - requesting no contact with Jamie Rickert be lifted.  Court modifies - while defendant is inmate in jail, he may have contact with Rickert.

10:31 a.m. - Defendant Michael J. Steinmetz in court with attorney Andrew J. Jarmuz.  Defendant Michael J. Steinmetz in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also calling 14cm421 (RH).  In 15cf71 - Schiek states close to an agreement - joint request for one more adjournment - State needs to provide some discovery material (CD's).  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 11:45 am.
from defendant requesting modification to bond.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

02:30 pm - Defendant Michael J. Steinmetz in court with attorney Andrew J. Jarmuz.  Defendant Michael J. Steinmetz in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.  State files Information.  Jarmuz in receipt of Information, waives reading and enters not guilty pleas.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 10:30 am.
